tweets.text: @DefraGovUK @EnvAgency Blimey! A year and three months late. No enforcement, dwindling effectiveness and an introduction by a Chief Executive who must be living in a parallel universe. Score - 3/10.

Today we have published our Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report.

It shows the importance of regulation in allowing industry to thrive while protecting air, land and water. 

Read the full report here - https://t.co/qDmR5R6ZSy https://t.co/jvZwAb1Vd7

urls.title: Regulating for people, the environment and growth
urls.description: Environment Agency annual reports on our regulation work and the environmental performance of regulated businesses in England.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has published the Regulating for People, the Environment and Growth report. 

Regulation is an important tool which we can use to leave the environment in a better state than we found it. 

Read the full report here: https://t.co/Vc0iVG4B5h https://t.co/ti45Wu0Hn4

Poor old @EnvAgency the wheels really are coming off the bus.

2019/20 target for "Kms of rivers enhanced", 2,300. 

Achieved? 1,753. Oops.

Target for 20/21 3,900.

Achieved in Q1? 31. Yes, that's right 31. Double oops.

PS. Can anyone tell me what "Enhanced", actually means? https://t.co/oa1m2WCN5V

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: 22/2/2021 @1700 Still 30 flood alerts across the South East, which might surprise some people. Many are now due to high groundwater levels. Here‚Äôs a great blog to explain more https://t.co/2tf44TRNhC Check your flood risk at https://t.co/64gyL62UXF #floodaware. https://t.co/vsaxmyfw7g

@Feargal_Sharkey @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency A definite contender. Enforcements haven't plummeted and it looks like they are used to fund the Environment Agency - picking the easy wins- ie most egregious incidents by big businesses and adopting a very light touch or ignoring the rest of reported incidences.
@JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife @Natures_Voice And another https://t.co/wBka7BKwJc

So apart from the totally meaningless corporate performance target "kms of rivers enhanced", it appears the @EnvAgency have pulled another funny with "reducing pollution incidents". Just make it go away, don't bother reporting it. "Trebles all round." üòÇ

https://t.co/7r5OGuYYQc

Tree maintenance work continues along #Broadgate to protect the current #flood defences in the area. This is being carried out for the Environment Agency and #Preston City Council by local contractors.

Find out more on the scheme: https://t.co/y1EkzOHvp7 https://t.co/7wuUUeiT9o

Oh god, double whammy - pollution event no2 - pumping  polluted water from crushed concrete into #ShuttertonBrook - watched them doing it. I‚Äôm so sick of people abusing the Environment, seems endless and who is monitoring them? @Teignbridge @EnvAgencySW #Dawlish #Devon https://t.co/g9FzlzbLKH

@JoKingDevon @EnvAgencySW @CwallWildlife @DevonWildlife So I got a helpful call back from the EA. It‚Äôs a palm oil spill out at sea the MCA are aware. A warning had gone out around the Wembury area, but it‚Äôs clearly spread. Relevant local authorities informed. The EA tried to contact @Natures_Voice as well but couldn‚Äôt get through.

SEPA and partners are tackling the emerging threat of abandoned waste trailers. Those caught risk a criminal conviction and a fine of up to ¬£40,000 and/or imprisonment.

Find out more üëâ https://t.co/fLsl6dzrsv

You can report any incidents at üëâ https://t.co/accJUx0uiS https://t.co/h8KL81Xsru
@Tony80663088 @EnvAgency will put a statement out soon I hope ü§ûüèªüé£
Anyone have any idea if night fishing is goin to be permitted??? I‚Äôm itching to get the snipers out...üòÇüòÇüê≥üê≥üé£üé£üé£ https://t.co/PubmbEthf3

Thursday 4th March at 10am

The Collaborative Procurement Symposium

Join us for insight into procurement from some of the region‚Äôs most forward thinking organisations: @AskNationwide
@SCFframeworks @EnvAgency

In collaboration with @WiP_SW @leadersmeets

https://t.co/6Ki18igjtS https://t.co/67Xf1RxWpC
@Melindola @JamesBevanEA @EnvAgency Or just incompetence.

Good regulation is vital if we are to protect the environment from emerging threats, including climate change. As we publish our latest report on regulatory performance in England (#RPEG), here are my thoughts on what good regulation looks like https://t.co/kkCDRFC1mB https://t.co/dAdHULfBTk

urls.title: Community information about Coastal Defences at Chiswell and West Bay ‚Äì Dorset Coast Forum
urls.description: The Dorset Coast Forum, in partnership with the Environment Agency and Dorset Council, has released an updated version of the ‚ÄòStorms and Coastal Defences at Chiswell‚Äô booklet. The storms witnessed at the end of January prompted an update to the booklet which was originally released in 2014 after recent winter storms. The booklet was produced for Chiswell residents on Portland to help inform the community on what to do in a storm event, explain how the coastal defences work and what may happen in the

tweets.text:
Tees Rural Crime Forum have launched a survey to understand how rural communities in #Cleveland feel about policing, community safety and crime. 

The results will help the OPCC and @ClevelandPolice work with partners on rural crime strategies.

Take part: https://t.co/iiHXgDAt6l https://t.co/ExoD3GVmpp
